Named lists

Source: R/helpers.R
nlist.Rd

Create a named list using specified names or, if names are omitted, using the names of the objects in the list. The code list(a = a, b = b) becomes nlist(a,b) and list(a = a, b = 2) becomes nlist(a, b = 2), etc.

nlist(...)

Arguments

...

Objects to include in the list.

Value

A named list.

Examples


# All variables already defined
a <- rnorm(100)
b <- mat.or.vec(10, 3)
nlist(a,b)
#> $a
#>   [1]  1.10811958 -0.87829676 -1.65681593 -1.69063570 -0.27132048 -1.15584660
#>   [7]  0.20405452  0.04701523 -0.51550139  0.01153985  0.55204616  1.32149314
#>  [13]  1.94724115 -0.57149695 -0.69384290 -1.96580236 -0.08385387  0.27190962
#>  [19] -2.46672879 -1.88824979  0.76100617 -1.31066493 -0.50296899  0.09770720

# Define some variables in the call and take the rest from the environment
nlist(a, b, veggies = c("lettuce", "spinach"), fruits = c("banana", "papaya"))
#> $a
#>   [1]  1.10811958 -0.87829676 -1.65681593 -1.69063570 -0.27132048 -1.15584660
